doctors.name: Saad Al Omar
doctors.qualifications:
4 years of experience
Bachelor's degree - Prince Sattam bin Abdulaziz University
doctors.biography: Saad Al Omar is a licensed chiropractor with over four years of clinical experience in musculoskeletal care. He focuses on restoring mobility, reducing pain, and improving overall functional performance using evidence-based chiropractic and rehabilitation techniques.
treatsCases: Hip and groin Injuries in Athletes
Chronic Knee Pain and Patellofemoral pain syndrome (PFPS)

doctors.name: Ahmed El Sabea
doctors.qualifications:
4 years of experience
Bachelor's degree - Prince Sattam bin Abdulaziz University
doctors.biography: Ahmed El Sabea is an experienced chiropractor specializing in spinal alignment, joint mobility, and pain management. He is committed to helping patients regain function and return to daily activities safely through personalized treatment plans.
treatsCases: Hip and groin Injuries in Athletes
Chronic Knee Pain and Patellofemoral pain syndrome (PFPS)

doctors.name: Fatma Elhasny
doctors.qualifications:
5 years of experience
Master's degree - King Saud University
doctors.biography: Fatma Elhasny is a physiotherapy specialist with a strong background in post-surgical and chronic condition rehabilitation. She combines manual therapy with modern physiotherapy techniques to help patients achieve long-term recovery.

doctors.name: Aly El Sennedy
doctors.qualifications:
6 years of experience
Doctor of Physical Therapy - Cairo University
doctors.biography: Aly El Sennedy is a Doctor of Physical Therapy with extensive experience in sports rehabilitation and advanced orthopedic cases. He works closely with athletes and active individuals to optimize performance and prevent re-injury.

doctors.name: Abdullah Al-Muhaya
doctors.qualifications:
3 years of experience
Bachelor's degree - King Abdulaziz University
doctors.biography: Abdullah Al-Muhaya specializes in pediatric and developmental physiotherapy. He focuses on improving motor skills, strength, and coordination in children and young patients through structured and compassionate rehabilitation programs.
